name: Holiday Inn Main Gate East

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I managed to get this hotel for less than $40 a night by booking on Priceline. You could not ask for a better hotel for the price. The hotel has a nice sized pool, a very convenient eatery on the lobby floor, and if it suits you, Alamo car rental in the lobby.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: There are many restaraunts and shops around and some provide discounts with your room key. The only draw-back was that our room had a roof view of one of the buildings, and it was littered with clothes, shoes, and old pizza boxes.
reviews.title: Great value and clean hotel.

reviews.text: Overall the hotel is very convenient to Disney World Theme Parks, and check with guest service desk for tickets. If you go to the desk the day you check in they offer you a resort preview that will save you a significant amount on park tickets.
reviews.title: Service was good, carpets smelled bad

reviews.text: We stayed here to meet our family who were in town for a dance competition at the Swan. We were a bit apprehensive as we usually go for higher rated accommodations but we were planning last minute and on a budget and this was what we got for what we bid on Priceline which ended up to cost half of the listed price.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: The building is off the main road and right next to a McDonalds, not my gig but probably great for families. There was ample parking in between and in front of the two buildings. Check in took about five minutes and the staff was very nice. We walked to our room which was in the second tower behind the main tower you see from the road and where you check in. We passed the pool area which was simple but nice. The room was clean and spacious with a large bathroom done in neutral granite. They had Bath and Body works coconut lime shampoo and body products which were nice. The bed was super comfy and the bankets were soft...we slept very well and normally sleep on memory foam. Our room overlooked the pool area and the main road with a mini amusement park, The room had a balcony which we didn't use but was nice with chairs an a small table.
reviews.title: Good location and friendly service

reviews.text: Rooms were noisy as doors stick and so you heard many slamming doors. Charges as a resort but no true resort features. Advertises in AAA for free continental breakfast but be warned they will not honour this unless you book ahead through the website and the ad does not state this.
reviews.title: better value found elsewhere

reviews.text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Main Gate East and honestly, the service was great and the room was fine. The bed was super comfortable and the A/C worked great. The pool was well maintained and hardly ever busy. I would reccomend going to McDonalds right next door for breakfast. The breakfast buffet is good but it's $10 per person. The shuttles only run once a day and our driver wasn't particularly friendly. I would reccomend renting a car while staying. A taxi to Disney is about $27 for the whole car ride one way. The shuttle only runs at 8 am for Magic Kingdom and 10 am for Epcot. Parking is only $15 at the parks! Bring your own stroller if you can it's $15 a day at Disney. I have no complaints about the hotel. It was very warm in the hallways but there is no a/c in the hallways so it is to be expected in a warm place like Florida. There was a few scratches on the wall and stains on the floor but that is to be expected at a well stayed in hotel of this rating. Don't expect the Ritz for $50 a night and it will be a fantastic stay!
reviews.title: Not as bad as it sounds

reviews.text: We always stay at this hotel when we go to Orlando. We though we'd try another hotel just to change it up a bit and book the Safari Sheridan in Orlando. Long story short, the Sheridan was absolutely utterly disgusting...... go read the reviews.
reviews.title: Never lets me down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After cancelling that reservation and heading over to my beloved Holiday Inn, the manager that night gave me two free drinks and dinner for my troubles FROM THE OTHER HOTEL! WHO DOES THAT!? They are great at this hotel. Very VERY clean. Clean pool. Bar in the lobby. Pizza hut and A&W in the lobby. Ill never stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Cannot believe Holiday Inn lets this property fly it's flag

reviews.text: This facility need a complete make-over. Perhaps the people that have rated this as a good place to stay do not have experience traveling and perhaps are on a low budget. The carpets are dirty (cannot imagine walking barefoot in the rooms), it smells musty everywhere, etc. The front desk staff was good. Holiday Inn headquarters needs to make an emergency trip to meet with owner of this property about what he/she will do to keep the flag. There are plenty of other good properties nearby including Holiday Inn Express. Get off 192 if you want some advice. I am a local who just needed to spend one night there while our home was being painted.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: The A/C unit goes on and off all night (unless you turn it off and roast) and sounds like you are sleeping next to a plane about to take off.
reviews.title: Like sleeping next to a jet engine

reviews.text: The pillows are the size and feel of a throw pillow from your college dorm room. I felt like I was sleeping on a old couch in someone's basement.
reviews.title: Zen stay, great location, outstanding staff

reviews.text: There are much better places near by.
reviews.title: Holiday inn is friendly and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DO NOT STAY HERE!
reviews.title: Golden Anniversary Stay

reviews.text: This hotel is another great holiday inn, clean rooms, courteus people, convinient to many things.
reviews.title: We loved it and we'll be back

reviews.text: We recently stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. This is the second time I stayed here. We checked in and we were given a corner room with a fridge and microwave. The room was huge, the bed was amazingly comfortable and the location was quiet. My only complaint about this hotel is that the bathrooms are very small and there's a faint odor in there. I think it's because there was no exhaust fan in there. The location is great for people wanting to visit any of the Disney parks. There's a lot of places to eat in the general area and there's a grocery store and pharmacies close by too. Across the street is Old Town, which is a small shopping area, rides and mini golf. This hotel is good for families! I will stay here again.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay and will stay here again

reviews.text: Family room was nice with kids section and 2 tv's. Nice location for disney and shopping. Large pool area but very crowded and water rather hot. At extra cost Hot or cold breakfast buffet option was good.Free internet. Front parking always full but more parking in the back at 2nd tower. Had a great 'Birthday deal' get the 2nd night free. Many spanish guests.
reviews.title: fine stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from staying at this hotel for 7 nights in August. We loved it!!!! Lovely big rooms with huge beds and bathroom!! View was brilliant overlooking the pool. No noise issues atall, a few ppl next door making noises on their phones early in the morning but the fan sound drounds this out!!
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL!! Spacious, clean and wicked location!!

reviews.text: Excellent location, just literally down the road from all the Disney parks and around 15mins away from Universal Studios. Brilliant restaurants on the road with Ponderosa and Sizzlin grill a 'must do' for breakfast. $3.99 all u can eat breakfasts, u cant go wrong!!
reviews.title: Well worth the money

reviews.text: Hotel was really clean, no issues atall there! The rooms were cleaned everyday and fresh towels etc. Pool is clean with lovely jacuzzi and kids pool. Staff are friendly and always greet you with a smile and pleasant manner!
reviews.title: Great accommodations - okay location

aka: Holiday Inn Main Gate East Hotel Kissimmee
description: Devote your time to fun activities at Holiday Inn, Main Gate East, located in Kissimmee, Florida, off U.S. Highway 192 East (also known as the Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway). We are an official Walt Disney Good Neighbor full-service hotel! Enjoy our newly renovated rooms, kid suites, meeting facilities, pool, kids theater, and business and fitness centers! Reminisce with M-I-C-K-E-Y M-O-U-S-E at the world-famous Walt Disney World resort in nearby Orlando. See the characters come alive at the Magic Kingdom. Travel to futuristic times at Epcot center. Witness pure movie magic at Disney s Hollywood Studios. Visit Osceola Heritage Park, a 120-acre multipurpose complex that offers exciting sports and entertainment shows. Catch a concert or event at the Silver Spurs Arena, or a baseball game at the Osceola County Stadium. Shop at the Loop, a large outdoor strip mall housing major department stores and smaller retail stores, casual restaurants, and a movie theater. Rev your engine and head to Old Town, a vibrant, family-friendly shopping, dining, and entertainment destination. Enjoy live entertainment each night and don t miss the Classic Car Cruises. Rejuvenate with a tasty hot breakfast at our Trattoria Cafe. Eat hearty from our Best-4-Breakfast menu. Enjoy a leisurely, peaceful vacation or comfortable working environment at our hotel, where Kids Stay Free and Kids Eat Free. Relax, it s Holiday Inn, Main Gate East.
